9th National Exhibition of Inventions and New Technology Opens 
   Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- The 9th national exhibition of inventions and new technology opened at the Three-Revolution Exhibition on September 6.
 Exhibited there are over 1,500 pieces of successful materials of invention and new technology in forms of actual object, model, treatise, diagram and CD. The materials were highly appreciated at the invention and ingenuity prize contests held by ministries, national institutions and social organizations and in every province.    
 During the exhibition the valuable scientific and technological successes will be disseminated and generalized in forms of presentation and demonstration lecture. And there will be technological exchange and circulation of new intellectual products.

Angling Competition Held on River Taedong 
   Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- A competition of angling fans of the ministries, national institutions and Pyongyang was held on the bank of the River Taedong flowing through Pyongyang on September 6.
 Over 40 anglers fully displayed their skill cultivated in the spare time after returning from their work by using up to four angling tools including angling rods, instruments and lines and various baits they had prepared for themselves.    
 The final placings were decided by the total length of the fishes caught in the designated time, not by the number and weight of the fishes as in the past.  Prizes were awarded to successful anglers at the end of the competition.

Palestinian Ambassador Hosts Reception
   Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Mohammad Shahta Zarab, Palestinian ambassador to the DPRK, gave a reception at the embassy on September 6 on the occasion of the 58th anniversary of the foundation of the DPRK.
 Present there on invitation were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Ryom Sun Gil, chairman of the C.C., the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, Mun Jae Chol, acting chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned.    
 Speeches were made at the reception.
